projects.name: Personal Website
projects.description: Making my own website had been something that I was putting off for quite a long time mainly because I do not enjoy the tedious process of web design. I used Figma to plan out how my website should look before I started coding. I chose TypeScript and Next.js v13 mainly because they are trendy and I wanted to get better at using them. For design, I took inspiration from other developers' websites and tried to follow material design guidelines. I used few external libraries to add some components and animations.  I kept all website data static in the filesystem because it is easier to scale and modify later on. For deployment, I used vercel because it intergrates very smoothly with Next.js applications.

projects.name: ChatApp
projects.description: Prior to learning React Native I had no experience with mobile apps development whatsoever and this app was my attempet for utilizing all the things I learned about React Native. I used Expo because it makes it very easy to test your app directly on a physical device and has many other handy feautres. I used extenral libraries such as React Navigation for navigation, React-Native-Gifted-Chat for different chat components, and Redux for data management. For backend, I used node.js, Socket.io, and Mongo.db.

projects.name: NewsApp
projects.description: I built this website to practice using React with Redux for data management. I used NewsAPI for getting news articles.

projects.name: 쓰레기 공작소
projects.description: I did this project as part of a team at univesity for a class final project. The platform is centered around promoting recycling awareness and educating users about effective recycling practices, such as providing information about trash disposal schedules within the Seoul city area. We used KakaoMap API to obtain maps and and present relevant data on them. I was particularly responsible about designing the UI and coding the backend for this project.
